subject: Management
title: Delegation vs Dumping
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Delegation vs Dumping.

hook.text: An intern was told 'handle this' with no context, no deadline, and no support. She failed.

buildup.text: Dumping is tossing work at someone without clarity. Delegation is a structured handoff.

discovery.text: True delegation includes the what, the why, the boundaries, and the support.

twist.text: Managers who dump work blame the person. Those who delegate well blame the process.

climax.text: A good delegation conversation takes five minutes and saves five hours of confusion.

punchline.text: Delegation without context is just dumping.

quiz.question: What distinguishes delegation from dumping?
options: Delegation includes context, clarity, and support
Delegation means doing the task together
